## Biography

I am a second-year PhD student in **Biostatistics** at **Columbia University**, advised by Dr. [Tian Gu](https://www.gutian.info/).

Prior to joining Columbia, I received my Bachelor's degree in **Mathematics and Applied Mathematics** at **Shanghai Jiao Tong University**, advised by Dr. [Lin Liu](https://linliu-stats.github.io/).

My research interests lie at the intersection of **Knowledge Transfer**, **Adaptive Data Fusion**, and , with particular application to high-dimensional biological data and Electronic Health Records (EHR). 

Please feel free to reach out via email for collaboration!

:::

## Research Interests

I focus on developing robust statistical learning and machine learning technique to enhance model generalizability to support precise and accurate diagnostics, individualized treatments, and improve patient outcomes. Currently, I am working on:

* **Transfer Learning:** 
* **Generative Models:** Applications of diffusion models in EHR data.
* **Optimization:** Theory behind non-convex optimization in deep learning.
